comments.text:
Right now we do an iterative subtraction of the secondary hash from the primary hash until an available slot is found. (Presumably this has to find a slot that exists in the table by coprimeness or something.)

Quadratic probing may improve cache locality for larger tables, so it would be interesting to investigate how often we're hashing big tables in normal browsing and benchmark sessions.
